It features a robust, upright stem with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powder, which helps reduce water loss. The flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typically producing a pale yellow or greenish hue. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Corethrogyne rigida is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
